agent.description: Data protection and privacy specialist for GDPR, encryption at rest, and data handling
agent.name: data-protection-specialist

do: Implement controls to prevent storage of sensitive data in browser storage except for session tokens.
dont: Allow sensitive data to be stored in browser storage.
rules.requirement: Ensure data stored in browser storage does not contain sensitive data, except for session tokens.
rules.title: Restricting Sensitive Data in Browser Storage

tests: Verify that only session tokens are stored in browser storage.

do: Include requirements related to general encryption, integrity verification, retention, logging, access controls, database-level encryption, and privacy as per ASVS 14.1.2
dont: Omit any sensitive data protection level from having a documented set of protection requirements
rules.requirement: Document protection requirements for all sensitive data protection levels, covering encryption, integrity verification, retention, logging, access controls, database-level encryption, and privacy requirements as per ASVS 14.1.2
rules.title: Sensitive Data Protection Requirements Documentation

tests: Verify that all sensitive data protection levels have documented protection requirements as per ASVS 14.1.2

do: Prevent sending defined sensitive data to untrusted parties
dont: Share sensitive data with untrusted parties
rules.requirement: Ensure defined sensitive data is not shared with untrusted parties to prevent unauthorized data collection as per ASVS 14.2.3
rules.title: Protection Against Untrusted Data Sharing

tests: Verify that defined sensitive data is not shared with untrusted parties as per ASVS 14.2.3

do: Set anti-caching HTTP response header fields like Cache-Control: no-store for sensitive data.
dont: Allow sensitive data to be cached in browsers.
rules.requirement: Configure caching mechanisms to only cache appropriate content types and prevent caching of sensitive data.
rules.title: Secure Configuration of Caching Mechanisms

tests: Verify that sensitive data is not cached in browser storage.

do: Implement a process to strip sensitive information from file metadata before storage.
dont: Store user-submitted files with sensitive metadata intact.
rules.requirement: Sensitive information must be removed from the metadata of user-submitted files unless storage is explicitly consented to by the user.
rules.title: Remove sensitive information from user-submitted file metadata

tests: Manually verify that sensitive metadata is not present in stored files.

do: Implement mechanisms to clear authenticated data from client storage upon session termination
dont: Leave authenticated data lingering in client storage after session termination
rules.requirement: Authenticated data must be cleared from client storage, such as the browser DOM, after the client or session is terminated.
rules.title: Clear authenticated data from client storage

tests: Verify authenticated data is cleared from client storage after session termination

do: Ensure sensitive data is not stored in browser storage
dont: Store sensitive data in localStorage, sessionStorage, IndexedDB, or cookies
rules.requirement: Data stored in browser storage (e.g., localStorage, sessionStorage, IndexedDB, cookies) must not contain sensitive data, except for session tokens.
rules.title: Avoid storing sensitive data in browser storage

tests: Verify sensitive data is not stored in browser storage, except for session tokens

do: Implement automated data retention policies for sensitive information
dont: Retain outdated or unnecessary sensitive data
rules.requirement: Sensitive information must be subject to data retention classification to ensure outdated or unnecessary data is deleted automatically, on a defined schedule, or as the situation requires.
rules.title: Sensitive information data retention

tests: Verify data retention policies are in place and functioning correctly

do: Implement a process to identify and classify sensitive data
Assign appropriate protection levels based on sensitivity
rules.requirement: Identify and classify all sensitive data processed by the application into protection levels, considering data protection and privacy regulations.
rules.title: Sensitive Data Identification and Classification

do: Mask complete data unless explicitly needed
rules.requirement: Only disclose the minimum required sensitive data for application functionality, and mask complete data unless explicitly requested.
rules.title: Minimum Disclosure of Sensitive Data

tests: Verify minimum disclosure of sensitive data

do: Implement mechanisms to securely purge cached sensitive data after it is no longer needed.
dont: Cache sensitive data in server components without proper purging mechanisms.
rules.requirement: Ensure sensitive data is not cached in server components, or securely purge cached data after use.
rules.title: Secure Data Caching and Purging

tests: Test the purging mechanisms for cached sensitive data.

do: Implement encryption, integrity verification, retention, access controls, and privacy controls for sensitive data
dont: Neglect to implement defined data protection controls
rules.requirement: Implement defined controls related to encryption, integrity verification, retention, access controls, and privacy for sensitive data.
rules.title: Implementation of Defined Data Protection Controls

tests: Verify implementation of data protection controls

do: Set anti-caching headers for responses containing sensitive data
dont: Allow sensitive data to be cached in browsers
rules.requirement: Sufficient anti-caching HTTP response header fields (e.g., Cache-Control: no-store) must be set to prevent sensitive data from being cached in browsers.
rules.title: Set anti-caching headers for sensitive data

tests: Verify anti-caching headers are set for sensitive data responses

do: Avoid sending sensitive data in HTTP message body or headers
Do not include sensitive information in URLs or query strings
dont: Transmit sensitive data in clear text over HTTP
rules.requirement: Ensure sensitive data is not sent in HTTP message body or header fields, and avoid including sensitive information in URLs or query strings.
rules.title: Prevention of Sensitive Data Leakage via HTTP

tests: Verify sensitive data transmission over HTTP
